entry.title: Can't open Android context menu Web Search tab inside current tab group
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Be inside a tab group. 2. Highlight some text within one of the tabs inside the tab group. 3. Tap "Web Search" in the Android Chrome context menu. 4. Web Search for the highlighted text is opened in a tab outside of the current tab group.
# Problem Description Intended behavior: having the context menu-prompted Web Search tabs open in the current tab group. Actual behavior: context menu-prompted Web Search tabs open outside of the current tab group. Thank you for looking into this.
# Summary Can't open Android context menu Web Search tab inside current tab group
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: The button to Relaunch the chrome tabs is not working properly.
entry.content:
Chrome Version : Version 124.0.6367.60 (Official Build) (arm64) URLs (if applicable) : OS version : Monteray 12.1 Behavior in Chrome: When you click on the Relaunch tabs button for update. After the update is done there is a dialogue box which shows Relaunch Button. Clicking on it doesn't close the browsers normally. You need to click twice or thrice properly to close the browsers and open it again.
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Make sure your browser is due for update (2) Click on Update Chrome (3) A dialogue box will open which says update is completed relaunch browser/tabs (4) Click on the Relaunch button. Nothing will happen. Then you wait for sometime and click again 1 or 2 times. Then the browsers get closed and tabs open again.
What is the expected result? The browser gets closed in a simple click on the button
What happens instead? It's irritating for the user to click again and again. And the user may decide to not update the browser which can lead to a security vulnerability.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about:gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Omnibox keeps searching for localhost instead of visiting the page
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6422.3 (Official Build) canary (arm64) OS: macOS Version 14.4.1 (Build 23E224)
What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Run chrome with the following flags: --force-fieldtrials="*OmniboxMlScoringWithCachingDesktop/Control_50pct/*OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop/EnabledConservative_25pct_20240405/*OmniboxOnDeviceHeadModelSelectionFix/Default" --force-fieldtrial-params="OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop.EnabledConservative_25pct_20240405:MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlending/true/MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlendingGroupingThreshold/1000/MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlendingMax/2000/MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlendingMin/0/MlUrlSearchBlending_StableSearchBlending/false" --enable-features="MlUrlSearchBlending<OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop"
(2) Enter 'http://localhost:8080' in the omnibox
What is the expected result? The page (with the globe icon) is the top result
What happens instead? It tries to use the search engine instead.
Running chrome with --disable-features="MlUrlSearchBlending<OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop" seems to fix the issue for me. And resetting my field trials seems to fix it as well.

entry.title: evaluateJavaScript is not type compatible in Swift
entry.content:
This is another finding when exposing //ios/web_view to Swift code where nullable/nonnullable results in distinct types (Optional<Foo> vs Foo).
evaluateJavascript, the current updated version has three differences to the WKWebView version:
1. The callback argument is called completion instead of completionHandler which looks to be because there was another version that had completionHandler already which has since beeen removed. 2. The callback is not optional in Swift which is unfortunate since calling it with nil is very common. 3. The error argument in the callback is not optional which creates an unnecessary type difference

entry.title: Single clicking the title bar when maximized forces a resize
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open chrome 2. Ensure chrome is maximized 3. Click away from chrome or load another app such that the Chrome window no longer has primary focus 3. Single click any open space on the title bar that isn't a tab, tab creation button, or window sizing buttons 4. Verify the window is resized and given primary focus rather than simply focused
# Problem Description This is occurring on Ubuntu 24.04. I have confirmed this occurs with chrome beta and dev builds as well.
When single clicking on the title bar while some other window has focus, focus should be restored but the browser window should not resize out of its maximized state.
When single clicking the title bar while it is NOT maximized, the window does not change size or restore maximization.
This behavior does not occur on Windows.
This behavior does not occur if using the "System title bars" instead of the default Chrome title bars.
This behavior does not occur in Firefox.
# Additional Comments Attached is a screencast of this taking place, using the calc app in front of the browser with focus, then single clicking the title bar while maximized to demonstrate the unexpected resize behavior.
# Summary Single clicking the title bar when maximized forces a resize
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: If text contain unsupported unicode encoding all Kanji will not be displayed correctly
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Video: https://youtu.be/sBXD3xltNxw
1. Open https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%F0%B0%BB%9D%F0%B0%BB%9D%E9%9D%A2 2. Type something in the address bar
# Problem Description Under macOS(14.4.1 (23E224) m1 pro), if the tab title bar and address bar contain unsupported unicode encoding, all Chinese characters (Kanji) that appear later will not be displayed correctly.
macOS下，Tab标题栏和地址栏如果包含不支持的Unicode编码会导致后面出现的所有汉字都无法正确显示。
# Summary If text contain unsupported unicode encoding all Kanji will not be displayed correctly
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Performance regression issue related to Blink Accessibility events
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a new Chrome Tab, and open this link https://illustrator.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:AP:755a3bda-ecd2-476b-bf39-00ddfde4e19a 2. Run the DevTools performance profiling and till the link is fully opened (may take 5-15 seconds) and analyze the main thread call stacks. 3. On profiling, it looks the Main Thread spending ~4 seconds in Blink.Accessibility.UpdateTime > ProcessDeferredAccesibilityEvents.
# Problem Description I am seeing a potential performance regression issue with recent Chrome updates related to Blink Accessibility events. AI Web launch performance (I am using M1 Machine, Sonoma 14.4.1, Chrome Version 123.0.6312.107(arm64), but was happening on older os 13.x too) seems to degrade by upto 4 seconds (from ~4secs to ~8 secs). On profiling, it looks the Main Thread spending ~4 seconds in Blink.Accessibility.UpdateTime > ProcessDeferredAccesibilityEvents. When I launch Chrome with accessibility disabled (open -n -a "Google Chrome" --args www.adobe.com --disable-renderer-accessibility), the issue is no more reproducible so its seems bug is related to accessibility handing in Chrome. Our app is doing nothing in general related to accessibility. Moreover, the issue is not consistent on all machines hence I need Google Accessibility team or Blink rendering team help to isolate this regression. Sample Link: (not sure if it will repro on the machines you will try) https://illustrator.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:AP:755a3bda-ecd2-476b-bf39-00ddfde4e19a Can someone include relevant folks in this thread?
# Additional Comments This issue is happing on specific machines.
When I launch Chrome with accessibility disabled (open -n -a "Google Chrome" --args www.adobe.com --disable-renderer-accessibility), the issue is no more reproducible so its seems bug is related to accessibility handing in Chrome.
# Summary Performance regression issue related to Blink Accessibility events
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Internals
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Add annotation to reject invalid script state
entry.content:
In [this CL](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/5428013) I was trying to eliminate the boilerplate of checking for invalid script state but ran into the problem that the `Reject` call takesthe invalid script state, which [causes the promise to be `undefined`](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-rel/b8751512266083748593/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fvirtual%2Fmodel-execution%2Fwpt_internal%2Fmodel-execution%2Frun-from-detached-iframe.html+VHash%3Acd53377797674ec7&clean=&sortby=&groupby=).
The bindings code avoids this because it uses the receiver's script state in ExceptionToRejectPromiseScope.
I would like to just annotate my bindings with something like `RejectInvalidScriptState` and remove `RaisesException` and not even call my impl if the script state is invalid.

entry.title: chromium net_unittests WebSocketEndToEndTest.HttpsWssProxyUnauthedFails hangs with latest vpython
entry.content:
In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5458681 , I tried to update vpython to the latest released version for the test configuration. This caused WebSocketEndToEndTest.HttpsWssProxyUnauthedFails to reliably time out.
We believe there may be a locking bug in vpython related to starting two python test servers concurrently. We should be able to fix it in vpython if so.

entry.title: PrefetchManager discards body data, but it is still decompressed
entry.content:
When PrefetchManager prefetches a resource, it is decompressed but then the decompressed bytes are discarded, wasting CPU and blocking the IO thread from doing useful work.
This is particularly bad when a resource is fetched from cache, as large chunks will be decompressed at a rapid rate.
This also applies to prewarm and other users of SimpleURLLoader::DownloadHeaderOnly().

entry.title: Make ServiceWorkerRouterInfo.matched_source_type and relevant fields optional
entry.content:
Current implementation assumes `ServiceWorkerRouterinfo.matched_source_type` as non-null value.
This might cause some bugs when router info could not be evaluated, making it set to a default value and hard to differentiate the "default value" vs "failed value".
Fix this by making this field and relevant fields optional.

entry.title: Unable to click or select the Pin option
entry.content:
Chrome Version :126.0.6424.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) Revision :9918af031214474802325bba67c330825e8b22dc-refs/branch-heads/6424@{#1}
OS: Win(10,11), Mac and Linux
Pre Conditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2. Click on Customize Chrome and right click on pen icon beside Omnibox. 3. Try to click pin but unable to click the pin option. 4. Unable to click or select the Pin option.
Actual Result : Unable to click or select the Pin option.
Expected Result : Able to click or select the Pin option.
This Issue is exists from M-122 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Please find the attached screencast below..! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MBPQsHo6AguBRUF0NNBbxcsmcDllpl7W/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. This issue is able to repro on Stable #123.0.6312.122, Beta #125.0.6422.4 and Dev #125.0.6420.3
Thank You...!!

entry.title: Elements tab in debug tools should support full-text search
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open debug tools and access the elements tab 2. Click into the search box 3. search for 'rel=' 4. content such as 'rel="canonical"' is no longer found
# Problem Description should be obvious from steps to reproduce
# Summary Elements tab in debug tools should support full-text search
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Feature - Request for new or improved features
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Selinux error starting Chrome dev
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Start Chrome Couldnt reproduce, happend once Main window started but with error, restarted and no problem Maybe it's related to this Fedora bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2275476
# Problem Description Fedora Linux 39 Kernel ver:6.8.6-200.fc39.x86_64
Commandline: /usr/bin/google-chrome-unstable --ignore-gpu-blocklist --ozone-platform=wayland --incognito --enable-features=UseOzonePlatform,VaapiVideoDecodeLinuxGL,VaapiVideoDecoder,VaapiIgnoreDriverChecks --disable-features=UseChromeOSDirectVideoDecoder,EyeDropper --flag-switches-begin --enable-gpu-rasterization --enable-quic --enable-zero-copy --ignore-gpu-blocklist --ozone-platform-hint=auto --enable-features=UseOzonePlatform,VaapiVideoDecodeLinuxGL,VaapiVideoDecoder,VaapiIgnoreDriverChecks,UseMultiPlaneFormatForHardwareVideo,UseOutOfProcessVideoDecoding,WebAssemblyBaseline,WebAssemblyTiering --disable-features=UseChromeOSDirectVideoDecoder,EyeDropper,WebBluetooth --flag-switches-end
Chrome errors:
./chrome.sh [68174:1:0417/204148.899078:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68175:1:0417/204148.899266:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68205:1:0417/204148.931094:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68243:1:0417/204149.031090:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68257:1:0417/204149.049456:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68262:1:0417/204149.054528:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [0417/204149.056402:ERROR:file_io_posix.cc(145)] open /proc/68262/auxv: Permission denied (13) [0417/204149.056467:ERROR:ptracer.cc(454)] ptrace: No such process (3) [0417/204149.056475:ERROR:ptracer.cc(480)] Unexpected registers size 0 != 216 [0417/204149.056480:WARNING:process_reader_linux.cc(400)] Couldn't initialize main thread. [0417/204149.056500:ERROR:ptracer.cc(567)] ptrace: No such process (3) [0417/204149.056503:ERROR:process_snapshot_linux.cc(78)] Couldn't read exception info [0417/204149.056532:ERROR:scoped_ptrace_attach.cc(45)] ptrace: No such process (3) [68270:1:0417/204149.056702:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68285:1:0417/204149.070467:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange). [68100:68100:0417/204149.181353:ERROR:service_worker_task_queue.cc(256)] DidStartWorkerFail lanfdkkpgfjfdikkncbnojekcppdebfp: 3 [68326:1:0417/204149.296587:ERROR:v8_initializer.cc(811)] V8 process OOM (Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange).
SELINUX error (12 times the same error, different threads): ---- time->Wed Apr 17 20:41:48 2024 type=AVC msg=audit(1713397308.898:691): avc: denied { execheap } for pid=68174 comm="chrome" scontext=unconfined_u:unconfined_r:unconfined_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tcontext=unconfined_u:unconfined_r:unconfined_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=process permissive=0 ----

# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? The whole browser
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know

entry.title: Layers are not searchable using search bar in styles panel
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open search bar in styles panel 2. Search for the name of a CSS style layer <> 3. No results are returned
# Problem Description Layers <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@layer> are a very useful new way to organize css rules, especially for complex projects like open source web frameworks.
See screenshot: https://i.imgur.com/fe4zyms.png
However it would be very useful if you could use the layer names to search for a given rule. Currently this does not appear to be supported
https://i.imgur.com/fe4zyms.png
# Summary Layers are not searchable using search bar in styles panel
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: Remove the error handling of checked math values for triangular implementation for DirectML
entry.content:
This was raised in Chromium CL-5387867 discussion: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5387867/comment/93d9d1fc_69097587/
All error handling of checked_math values inside the implementation of triangular for directml backend should be removed and performing proper validation at graph creation time.

entry.title: My external bluetooth USB Adaptor is no longer being recognized.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Plug in USB 2. Turn on computer 3.Attempt to pair with bluetooth headphones
# Problem Description My external bluetooth USB Adaptor is no longer being recognized. I have had issues with the inbuilt Bluetooth receiver on my ASUS CM34 14 8/256GB R5 2IN1CB whereby there was audio lag with my Sony bluetooh headphones. I purchased a Hideez USB Bluetooth Adapter which once plugged in, tookover from the inbuilt Bluetooth and solved the problem. Since the update, the USB no longer takes over and the blue light on the USB no longer stays on (flashes briefly).
# Summary My external bluetooth USB Adaptor is no longer being recognized.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: archive_summary.is_encrypted does not account for nested archives
entry.content: We have some download pings with an outer archive that's unencrypted and an inner archive that's encrypted. The archive_summary.is_encrypted field is false though. Ops would prefer that any encryption detected at any level of nesting be accounted for in the archive_summary. That seems reasonable to me.

entry.title: MacBook Air M1 and M3 have fans running at high speed. Pages load slow. General unresponsiveness.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. MacBook Air M1 or M3 running 14.4.1 2. Install Chrome 124.0.6367.62 or 124.0.6367.61 3. Run Google Meet tab and a few other tabs. Users were running about ten tabs or more.
# Problem Description It seems in the month of April which coincides with 123->124 release, about a dozen MacBook Air 13" M1 and M3 models have had the fans run fast on their machines. Users also reported that running Google Meet, and other tabs with video or general web browsing become sluggish or unresponsive. We've confirmed they are not managed Chrome browsers. Confirmed it's not DNS (users are at home or different offices). No other software on their machine would create this behavior. It seems to have come all at once in the last week or two with these models we have running in our environment.
# Summary MacBook Air M1 and M3 have fans running at high speed. Pages load slow. General unresponsiveness.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [TFLite] Support last dimension broadcastable for Prelu
entry.content:
XNNPACK delegate doesn't support to broadcast last dimension for prelu operation and [TFLite kernal](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/tflite/src/tensorflow/lite/kernels/activations.cc;l=1454;drc=11c6fee8868a670b11ae04cf5649f7805f6cc16a?q=third_party%2Ftflite%2Fsrc%2Ftensorflow%2Flite%2Fkernels%2Factivations.cc&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc) isn't used because VisitPreluNode function validate it can be supported.
This issue comes from [the comments of CL review](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5457851/comment/3e6a1878_fa47c275/).

entry.title: requestFullscreen not implemented in headless shell
entry.content:
requestFullscreen not implemented in headless shell, and that is causing many WPTs to timeout. Some of them are listed below:
external/wpt/html/semantics/popovers/popover-top-layer-nesting-anchor.tentative.html external/wpt/html/semantics/popovers/popover-top-layer-nesting-hints.tentative.html external/wpt/html/semantics/popovers/popover-top-layer-nesting.tentative.html And around 50 tests in external/wpt/fullscreen/
How to reproduce: $autoninja -C out/Release chrome chromedriver $third_party/blink/tools/run_wpt_tests.py --release -p headless_shell the-test-name

entry.title: Deep scan notice padding is incorrect
entry.content: UX informs me the padding should be more even on both sides of the icon (see screenshot). This is unfortunate, because it means we're extending into the DownloadBubbleRowView border.

entry.title: Fix NewTabPage preloading experiment
entry.content:
To restart the launch experiment of NewTabPage (NTP) preloading trigger, we should inspect implementation and fix all known issues.
See issue 326509142 for the context.

entry.title: ViewHighlighter lies on nullable ConstantState from the background
entry.content: ViewHighlighter relies on Drawable#getConstantState() which is nullable according to the docs. This will NPE in some cases, so an alternative should be found to support this.

entry.title: Add Compose.Session.EventCounts UMA for edit results
entry.content:
Copied from https://b.corp.google.com/issues/335463989
Add two events along the lines of: - ResultEdited - EditedResultInserted

entry.title: Have submodules with new commits after running gclient sync
entry.content:
When checking out tip of tree (git fetch && git rebase && gclient sync), I often have new commits on submodules, even though gclient sync successfully runs.
``` yangsharon@sy:~/chromium/src$ gclient sync -D Syncing projects: 100% (436/436), done. Running hooks: 23% (52/218) perfetto_testdata ________ running 'vpython3 src/base/tracing/test/test_data.py download' in '/usr/local/google/home/yangsharon/chromium' Nothing to do, all files are synced Running hooks: 100% (218/218), done. yangsharon@sy:~/chromium/src$ git status On branch tokenmap1 Your branch and 'origin/main' have diverged, and have 1 and 268 different commits each, respectively. (use "git pull" if you want to integrate the remote branch with yours)
Changes not staged for commit: (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed) (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory) modified: third_party/chromite (new commits)
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a") ```
My local .gclient config: ``` solutions = [ { "url": "https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git", "managed": False, "name": "src", "custom_deps": {}, "custom_vars": { "checkout_telemetry_dependencies": True, "checkout_src_internal": True, "download_remoteexec_cfg": True, } } ] target_os = [ # "fuchsia", "android", # "win", # "mac" ] ```

entry.title: Coverage missing from blink_wpt_tests
entry.content: In [this CL](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5446324) the code in `third_party/blink/renderer/modules/geolocation/geolocation_coordinates.cc` is flagged as having no coverage even though the new test in `third_party/blink/web_tests/wpt_internal/geolocation-api/json.https.html` exercised this code in [the `linux-rel` tryjob](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-rel/1782155/overview).

entry.title:

entry.title: Reduce cache sizes to 300
entry.content: Based on this metric https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/timeline_v2?sid=338dc3e3cc3bbce7429f34c1041bed23, I think we can limit the cache sizes to 300
